item.title: Dutch phone giant Odido says millions of customers affected by data breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The Dutch phone giant Odido is the latest phone and internet company to be hacked in recent months, as governments and financially motivated hackers continue to steal highly confidential information about phone customers.

item.title: Amazon’s Ring cancels partnership with Flock, a network of AI cameras used by ICE, feds, and police
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: This news comes less than a week after Ring's Super Bowl commercial stoked controversy over the company's capacity for mass surveillance.

item.title: Cohere’s $240M year sets stage for IPO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Cohere surpassed $240 million in annual recurring revenue in 2025, highlighting strong enterprise AI demand as the Canadian startup positions itself for a potential IPO amid intensifying competition from OpenAI and Anthropic.

item.title: Meta plans to add facial recognition to its smart glasses, report claims
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The feature, internally known as “Name Tag,” would allow smart glasses wearers to identify people and get information about them via Meta's AI assistant.

item.title: Score, the dating app for people with good credit, is back
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Two years ago, a controversial dating app was launched and quickly shuttered: for people with good-to-excellent credit. Now, the founder is relaunching it, open to anyone.

item.title: Fusion startup Helion hits blistering temps as it races toward 2028 deadline
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Helion's Polaris device hit 150 million degrees C recently, a milestone that nudges the company toward its commercial power plant that will sell electricity to Microsoft.

item.title: Waymo is asking DoorDash drivers to shut the doors of its self-driving cars
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: If a passenger accidentally leaves a Waymo door open, the vehicle can get stuck in place.

item.title: For $1M, you can pay Bryan Johnson (or BryanAI?) to teach you how to live longer
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The longevity-obsessed investor Bryan Johnson is charging $1 million to sign up for his "Immortals" program.

item.title: Amid disappointing earnings, Pinterest claims it sees more searches than ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Pinterest's stock tumbles after an earnings miss, with higher-than-expected usage its only bright spot.

item.title: IBM will hire your entry-level talent in the age of AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: IBM plans to triple its entry-level hiring in the U.S. in 2026, but these jobs will have different tasks than in previous years.

item.title: Rivian was saved by software in 2025
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The company's annual revenue was boosted by its technology joint venture with Volkswagen Group.

item.title: Musk needed a new vision for SpaceX and xAI. He landed on Moonbase Alpha.
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: "I really want to see a mass driver on the moon that is shooting AI satellites into deep space."

item.title: Didero lands $30M to put manufacturing procurement on ‘agentic’ autopilot
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Didero functions as an agentic AI layer that sits on top of a company’s existing ERP, acting as a coordinator that reads incoming communications and automatically executes the necessary updates and tasks.

item.title: Anthropic raises another $30B in Series G, with a new value of $380B
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The infusion of funding for the AI startup takes place as it is vying for customers and cultural attention with its competitor, OpenAI.

item.title: YouTube finally launches a dedicated app for Apple Vision Pro
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: When Apple Vision Pro first came out two years ago, YouTube hesitated to release a dedicated app. Today is the day they officially launch one.

item.title: Hacker linked to Epstein removed from Black Hat cyber conference website
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Emails published by the Justice Department revealed cybersecurity veteran Vincenzo Iozzo emailed, and arranged to meet, Jeffrey Epstein multiple times between 2014 and 2018.

item.title: Trump administration undermines EPA enforcement of Clean Air Act
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The EPA's new rule seeks to undo a 2009 finding that allowed the federal government to regulate six greenhouse gases.

item.title: Automattic planned to target 10 competitors with royalty fees, WP Engine claims in new filing
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: WP Engine claims Automattic was going to target more hosting companies with royalty fees.

item.title: Spotify says its best developers haven’t written a line of code since December, thanks to AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify credits Claude Code and its internal AI system Honk with speeding up development.

item.title: A new version of OpenAI’s Codex is powered by a new dedicated chip
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: OpenAI calls the new coding tool the "first milestone" in its relationship with the chipmaker.
